title: Martinez stuns Galahad to take IBF featherweight title
description: Kid Galahad suffers a devastating defeat in his maiden defence of the IBF world featherweight title, knocked out in the sixth round by Spaniard Kiko Martinez.

title: Covid: Dutch accept life within 'lockdown-lite'
description: Most in the Netherlands support a new lockdown-lite, despite anti-lockdown protests making headlines.

title: COP26: Alok Sharma fights back tears as Glasgow Climate Pact agreed
description: The COP26 president apologised as a late amendment on coal was added to the draft text by India.

title: Bottas beats Verstappen to Sao Paulo sprint win as Hamilton fights back
description: Mercedes driver Valtteri Bottas beats Red Bull's Max Verstappen in sprint qualifying and will start the Sao Paulo Grand Prix from pole position.

title: Australia and New Zealand set for unexpected World Cup final
description: Australia and New Zealand meet in an unexpected T20 World Cup final on Sunday, with both chasing their own pieces of history.

title: Poland-Belarus border: The BBC reports from the camps within touching distance of the EU
description: Steve Rosenberg reports from the migrant camps within touching distance of the EU.

title: Covid: 'No reason' not to give boosters to under-50s
description: Prof Neil Ferguson says giving booster jabs to younger age groups would drive down transmission levels.

title: Sara Duterte: Daughter of Philippines leader runs for vice-president
description: Sara Duterte will run alongside the son of the country's former dictator, Ferdinand Marcos.

title: BBC weatherman Owain Wyn Evans' drumathon raises £2m
description: Owain Wyn Evans says his "hands held up OK" during his 24-hour challenge for BBC Children in Need.

title: Abersoch: Life in a tourist town when the visitors have left
description: Abersoch sees its population of 600 skyrocket to 30,000 in the summer months.

title: Kendal Covid conspiracy brothers jailed for buying pistol
description: Harry and Ashley Wilson, from Kendal, believe the Covid jab turns people into "unthinking beings".

title: Survey criticised for asking children if they are too fat
description: Holly Rhys-Ellis, who had an eating disorder when she was 11, says such questions are unhelpful.

title: England picking Tuilagi on wing 'may make life easier' for Australia - Dawson
description: Eddie Jones may have "made life easier for Australia" by selecting Manu Tuilagi on the wing for Saturday's Twickenham encounter, says Matt Dawson.

title: Norwich City: Dean Smith set to be appointed as head coach
description: Dean Smith is set to become the new Norwich City head coach, with an announcement expected on Sunday or Monday.

title: Brentford stabbing: Man killed and elderly woman in critical condition
description: A man in his 30s is arrested on suspicion of murder and attempted murder.

title: COP26: New draft deal aims to close lingering divisions
description: The new draft is unlikely to heal splits over subsidies for fossil fuels and financial aid.

title: Scottish Conservative leader Douglas Ross in job 'sleaze' row
description: Douglas Ross failed to declare earnings as an MSP and as a football referee for the SFA.

title: Edinburgh heritage group worried over outdoor eating areas
description: The Cockburn Association says it fears temporary structures for outdoor eating in Edinburgh could be made permanent.

title: COP26: The story from Glasgow in 15 pictures
description: The most eye-catching demonstrations and unusual stories during COP26 have unfolded on the streets of Glasgow.

title: Brecon Beacons: Why do people navigate perilous caves for fun?
description: Caving enthusiasts say they experience beauty, friendship and peace while underground.

title: Oasis: Liam Gallagher's Wonderwall tambourine sold
description: The "battered" instrument was saved from the bin by a sound engineer.

title: Covid-19: Pandemic purchases and the unlikely faces of America's Covid culture war
description: Five things you need to know about the coronavirus pandemic this Saturday morning.

title: Indian activists who helped change the face of modern Britain
description: The friends "oiled the wheels of Indian independence" and challenged discrimination in the UK.

title: Cyborg knocks out Kavanagh to retain title - highlights & report
description: Reigning featherweight world champion Cris Cyborg claims the 11th first-round knockout of her career as she beats Ireland's Sinead Kavanagh in the main event of Bellator 271.

title: Hamilton & Verstappen under investigation after Sao Paulo qualifying
description: Title rivals Lewis Hamilton and Max Verstappen are under investigation after Hamilton's car was referred to stewards following Friday's qualifying race at the Sao Paulo Grand Prix.

title: Newspaper headlines: Covid 'end' prediction and PM 'pays price at polls'
description: Saturday's papers are varied, with the i weekend revealing when Whitehall expects the pandemic to end.

title: Britney Spears released from 13-year conservatorship
description: An LA judge terminates a legal guardianship set up by the 39-year-old pop star's father in 2008.

title: Period packs for footballers: 'Players can't talk to managers'
description: Friends Rachael and Jo have created a care package for people who play football while menstruating.

title: Iqaluit: A month without clean water in Canada's north
description: Frustration is growing in the Canadian city of Iqaluit after fuel contaminated the water supply.

title: Belarus border: Scrambling for facts in Europe's new crisis
description: Journalists and aid workers are kept away from the bleak spectacle of migrants on the Polish border.

title: Ship-load of 'toxic' Chinese fertilizer causes diplomatic stink
description: A ship carrying fertiliser from China to Sri Lanka is at the heart of a dispute between both allies.

title: Week in pictures: 6 - 12 November 2021
description: A selection of powerful images from all over the globe, taken this week.

title: BBC's Simpson revisits Afghanistan under the Taliban
description: In 2001, the BBC's World Affairs editor was part of a team which entered the city when the Taliban fell.

title: 'I could have been a racist killer'
description: As a teenager, Mike was an armed and angry US Nazi. Looking back, he fears he came close to murder.

title: Ros Atkins on... The fight for Nazanin's freedom
description: Ros Atkins looks at the story behind Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe's detention in Iran.

title: Young carers: The children missing from the system
description: Kim and Amy are among thousands of young carers missing out on support.
